sentences.sentence: sponsor Posted  September 1, 2020 in , Source:                nypost ,                   nypost ,                   thefederalist The novel Covid-19 virus has had the city of New York shut down for months now, leaving hundreds of thousands of hospitality workers unemployed.
So far, about 10,000 of the city’s restaurants have been able to open for business by participating in the outdoor eating program, but the other 15,000 restaurants in the city have not.

The outdoor eating program is scheduled to end in October, given the coming winter months, but Mayor DeBlasio is suggesting that perhaps it’s no time to give those struggling restaurants a possibility to open up, citing “coronavirus concerns.” sponsor Earlier this week, the CDC reported on its website that only 6% of Covid-19 deaths have been exclusively caused by Coronavirus, meaning that 94% of those deaths were people with other conditions.
It means that it is not Covid-19 itself that is reportedly killing people in 94% of those cases (as we have been led to believe), it is the factor of the co-morbidities.
That means that hundreds of thousands of people in New York City are currently unemployed because of a virus with over 90+% survival rate.
That means that businesses are being driven to the ground in New York City by mass hysteria, and not by facts.

Mayor DeBlasio suggested last week in a press briefing that he is reluctant to start indoor dining because it’s an activity for the middle- and upper-income New Yorkers, and that clashes with his pledge to transform New York, from a “tale of two cities,” to a progressive city.

DeBlasio was asked about indoor dining for student when school begins, to which the Mayor dismissed saying “I don’t think there’s a similarity at all.” indoor dining would be allowed in one circumstance , and not the other: “We have an imperative — a legal imperative, a moral imperative, an educational imperative– to give kids the best education we can.
We know that means having at least some time in person,” he said.
“Versus indoor dining, which is obviously a very optional activity, which some people do a lot who have the resources and others can’t do at all because they don’t have the resources,” he said.
Yes, Mayor DeBlasio, what you are taking away is choice, the choice of New Yorkers to socialize if they so choose to during the winter months.
You are also further castigating the hospitality industry.
The Mayor also seems to forget the thousands of cheap diners, fast-food eateries, pizza joints, and mom and pop joints, that cater to people looking for more cost-effective options.
Most likely because the rules will not apply to him.
Meanwhile, all of DeBlasio’s actions have propelled an exodus from New York by its wealthiest residents.
to Fox Business, a report from New World Wealth and Webster Pacific revealed that the combined wealth of the city deteriorated by $336 million by the end of June.
The moving companies in NY are seeing more business than ever, DeBlasio’s response “let them leave.” He also went on to say that it’s only temporary, and that NY’s tax base will be back.
